content.title: Short Term Fellowship under the Human Resource Development Programme for Health Research
content.details: Short Term Fellowship under the Human Resource Development Programme for Health Research aims to provide advanced training in India and abroad to medical and health research personnel in cutting-edge research areas related to medicine and health to create trained human resources for carrying out advanced research activities. The scheme is intended to create a pool of talented health research personnel in the country by upgrading the skills of medical students & faculty through specialized training in priority areas of health research in leading national and international institutions.
benefits: A consolidated stipend of ₹40,000/- per month for a period of stay in the host institute, which is at a different station from the parent Institute.
Expenditure on travel will be as per the T.A. rules of the parent organization.
One-time contingency grant of ₹20,000/- (maximum) to meet the expenses of local taxi charges, attending meetings, etc.
A consolidated stipend of US $ 3000/- per month for the period of stay in the host institute abroad.
Cost of air passage in economy class by Air India from the parent institute to the foreign host institute by the shortest possible route.
One-time contingency grant of ₹30,000 (maximum) to meet the expenses of local taxi charges visa fee and Health insurance, attending meetings, etc.
eligibility: Only Indian citizens working in Indian institutes are eligible.
They should hold M.D./ M.S./ M.D.S. or MBBS/BDS/ MVSc./ M.Sc./M.Pharma/M.Tech or equivalent with Ph.D. in health/biomedical research.
Faculty having at least three years’ experience in the college/institute as a regular employee.
Persons up to 55 years of age as of the last date of receipt of application will be eligible.

They should not have availed any fellowship of the duration of one month or above duration from any of the agencies of Govt. of India / State Governments for the same subject of training/research project.
content.application_process: The full-length research proposals may be submitted online only and no proposal in physical/hard copy is to be submitted w.r.t. the advertisements published in leading newspapers and uploaded on the websites of DHR & ICMR.
documents_required: Mandate Form from your working Institute
Format of Utilization certificate and Statement of expenditure

faqs.question: What is the aim of this programme?
faqs.answer: The aim of the programme is to provide advanced training in India and abroad to medical and health research personnel in cutting-edge research areas related to medicine and health to create trained human resources for carrying out advanced research activities.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the programme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to increase the overall availability of trained personnel for health research from medical colleges across the country through scholarships & fellowships for young medical doctors to take up medical and health research as a career.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this programme?
faqs.answer: Department of Health Research, Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Government of India.

faqs.question: What are the areas of research?
faqs.answer: Toxicology, Genomics, Proteomics, Geriatrics, Stem cell research, Clinical Trials, Good Clinical Practices (GCP), Good Laboratory Practices (GLP), Quality Control (QC) and Quality Assurance (QA), Modern Biology, Biotechnology, Genetics, Drugs Chemistry, Operational Research, Health Informatics, Medical Ethics, Disease Modelling, Health Economics, Environmental Health, Mental Health/Clinical Psychology, Any other area recommended by the committee as per National Health Policy/ National Health Goals.

faqs.question: Who are eligible to apply?
faqs.answer: The Indian citizens holding M.D./ M.S./ M.D.S. or MBBS/BDS/ MVSc./ M.Sc./M.Pharma/M.Tech or equivalent with Ph.D. in health/biomedical research and working in Indian institutes are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: How many years of experience do faculty need to apply under the programme?
faqs.answer: The faculty having at least three years’ experience in the college/institute as a regular employee.

faqs.question: What is the age limit to apply under the programme?
faqs.answer: The candidates up to 55 years of age as of the last date of receipt of application will be eligible to apply.

faqs.question: What is the duration of fellowship?
faqs.answer: The duration of fellowship is 1-3 months.

faqs.question: What is the amount of fellowship given to the fellows in Indian institutes?
faqs.answer: A consolidated stipend of ₹40,000/- per month for a period of stay in the host institute, which is at a different station from the parent Institute.

faqs.question: How much contingency grant is given to the fellows in Indian institutes?
faqs.answer: One-time contingency grant of ₹20,000/- (maximum) to meet the expenses of local taxi charges, attending meetings, etc.

faqs.question: What is the amount of fellowship given to the fellows in Foreign institutes?
faqs.answer: A consolidated stipend of US $ 3000/- per month (or equivalent in other foreign currency) for the period of stay in the host institute abroad.

faqs.question: How much contingency grant is given to the fellows in Foreign institutes?
faqs.answer: One-time contingency grant of ₹30,000 (maximum) to meet the expenses of local taxi charges visa fee and Health insurance, attending meetings, etc.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the programme?
faqs.answer: The full-length research proposals may be submitted online only and no proposal in physical/hard copy is to be submitted w.r.t. the advertisements published in leading newspapers and uploaded on the websites of DHR & ICMR.
